thread.title: General Electric, Honeywell, Google in spotlight
thread.title_full: General Electric, Honeywell, Google in spotlight

title: General Electric, Honeywell, Google in spotlight
text:
Published: July 16, 2015 6:03 p.m. ET Share General Electric is scheduled to report second-quarter earnings. 
By Sue Chang Markets reporter 
Among the companies whose shares are expected to see active trade in Friday’s session are General Electric Co., Honeywell International Inc. and Google Inc. 
Dow component General Electric GE, +1.01% is projected to report second-quarter earnings of 28 cents a share, according to a consensus survey by FactSet. The conglomerate earned 39 cents a share a year ago. 
Honeywell HON, -0.26% is forecast to post second-quarter earnings of $1.49 a share, up from $1.38 a share. 
After Thursday’s close, Google Inc. GOOGL, +3.05% reported its second-quarter earnings rose to $3.9 billion, or $6.51 a share, from $3.4 billion, or $4.96 a share, a year ago. Excluding items, Google earned $6.99 a share, topping analysts’ estimates of $6.70 a share. Revenue increased 11% to $17.7 billion, in line with expectations. 
Mattel Inc. MAT, -1.72% said it swung to a second-quarter loss of $11.4 million, or 3 cents a share from earnings of 8 cents a share a year ago. Sales totaled $988 million, down from $1.06 billion. Adjusted for one-time items, Mattel earned a penny a share. Analysts polled by FactSet had expected the maker of Barbie, Fisher Price toys, and Hot Wheels to report a loss of 4 cents a share. 
Hertz Global Holdings Inc. HTZ, -0.35% announced a restructuring plan, including additional steps to cut costs by as much as $300 million by the end of 2015. The car rental company also said it is committed to its previously-announced $1 billion stock buyback program. More from MarketWatch
